item.title: Linda add a quote by Mary Kay Ash
item.description: "Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway." -- Mary Kay Ash

item.title: Linda add a quote by Kin Hubbard
item.description: "A bee is never as busy as it seems; it's just that it can't buzz any slower." -- Kin Hubbard

item.title: Linda add a quote by Robert Green Ingersoll
item.description: "Reason, Observation and Experience — the Holy Trinity of Science — have taught us that happiness is the only good; that the time to be happy is now, and the way to be happy is to make others so. This is enough for us. In this belief we are content to live and die. If by any possibility the existence of a power superior to, and independent of, nature shall be demonstrated, there will then be time enough to kneel. Until then, let us stand erect." -- Robert Green Ingersoll

item.title: Linda add a quote by Helen Hunt Jackson
item.description: "Bee to the blossom, moth to the flame; Each to his passion; what's in a name? " -- Helen Hunt Jackson

item.title: Linda add a quote by Oliver St. John
item.description: "If a queen bee were crossed with a Friesian bull, would not the land flow with milk and honey?" -- Oliver St. John

item.title: Linda add a quote by Ashley Smith
item.description: "Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams." -- Ashley Smith

item.title: Linda add a quote by Peter Fonda
item.description: "It's wonderful to me that bees have this simple, age-old thing going on." -- Peter Fonda

item.title: Linda add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Linda add a quote by Norman Cousins
item.description: "Life is an adventure in forgiveness" -- Norman Cousins

item.title: Linda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Linda add a quote by Clarence Jordan
item.description: "The measure of a Christian is not in the height of his grasp but in the depth of his love" -- Clarence Jordan

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jimmy Carter
item.description: "We should live our lives as though Christ was coming this afternoon." -- Jimmy Carter

item.title: Linda add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The earth laughs in flowers." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Linda add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "I'd rather have roses on my table than diamonds on my neck." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Linda add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: Linda add a quote by Edward Payson Roe
item.description: "Look at us, said the violets blooming at her feet, all last winter we slept in the seeming death but at the right time God awakened us, and here we are to comfort you." -- Edward Payson Roe

item.title: Linda add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Linda add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Linda add a quote by Kālidāsa
item.description: "Yesterday is but a dream, Tomorrow is only a vision. But today well lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness, and every tomorrow a vision of hope." -- Kālidāsa

item.title: Linda add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Linda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jim Elliot
item.description: "He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain that which he cannot lose." -- Jim Elliot

item.title: Linda add a quote by Sir Edward Clarke K.C.
item.description: "As a lawyer I have made a prolonged study of the evidences for the events of the first Easter Day. To me the evidence is conclusive, and over and over again in the High Court I have secured a verdict on evidence not nearly so compelling. " -- Sir Edward Clarke K.C.

item.title: Linda add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble. Matthew 6:34" -- Anonymous

item.title: Linda add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ" -- Anonymous

item.title: Linda add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I've learned that you can tell a lot about a person by the way (s)he handles these three things: a rainy day, lost luggage, and tangled Christmas tree lights." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Linda add a quote by Jean Fritz
item.description: "When I discovered libraries, it was like having Christmas every day." -- Jean Fritz

item.title: Linda add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Linda add a quote by George S. Patton
item.description: "Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results." -- George S. Patton

item.title: Linda add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes
